ai.summary: Stage 10 of the London to Walsingham trail covers 29 km of challenging countryside in the UK, demanding good navigation, fitness, and preparation as you traverse varied terrain from rural lanes to rough trails.
ai.terrain_summary: A mix of urban fringe segments, quiet country lanes, grassy paths, muddy tracks, and short rocky sections with occasional gates and stiles; footing can be uneven and weather-dependent.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day in potentially remote rural terrain. Check the weather forecast, carry sufficient water and food, and ensure you have reliable navigation tools. Stay on public rights of way, respect landowners, and be prepared for limited phone signal; in the UK dial 999 in emergencies. Start early to maximize daylight and inform someone of your route and expected return time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Weather-appropriate clothing and a waterproof shell
Sufficient water (2–3 liters) and high-energy snacks
Map and compass or GPS device with offline maps
Fully charged phone and portable charger
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Light rain cover or packable rain gear
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn (April–June and September–October) for milder weather and longer daylight

seo.title: London to Walsingham – Stage 10 (29 km)
seo.meta_description: Stage 10 of the London to Walsingham trail in the UK covers 29 km of hard terrain, offering a demanding day of hiking with varied landscapes and rural routes.
